course.title: The American Novel: Dreiser to the Present
course.description: A survey of the 20th-century novel, its forms, patterns of ideas, techniques, cultural context, rivalry with film and radio, short story, and fact. Wharton, Age of Innocence; Cather, My Antonia; Hemingway, A Farewell to Arms and stories; Faulkner, The Sound and the Fury and stories; Fitzgerald, Tender is the Night; Ellison, Invisible Man; Nabokov, Lolita; Bellow, Herzog; Salinger, Catcher in the Rye and stories; Ha Jin, Waiting. Stories by James, London, Anderson, Gaitskill, Wallace, Beattie, Lahiri and Ford.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Aesthetic and Interpretive Understanding.
